attachments.title: hyperledger/hyperledger
attachments.text: Hyperledger Project is a new Collaborative Project at The Linux Foundation. The technical community is just getting started and will be adding code to the repository in the coming weeks. Check hype...

text: What are the expectations for the level of detail in a use-case? The ones currently in the wiki seem... a bit lightweight.
I would like to understand, for example, what the steps for trade settlement is, for example, and how the various entities would expect to interact with a blockchain implementation

Also: I don't know if this has come up, but Slack discussions are not visible to Google or to those who are not signed up here - I had some difficulty finding use-case documentation before I was directed here (and honestly, I would prefer not to have to use Slack to participate in a community effort)
The expectation is for a use case to follow a detailed template:  <https://github.com/hyperledger/hyperledger/wiki/Use-Case-Template>

text: yes I did. Thank you. I would indicate the readiness of the use cases in that list
I had some trouble finding things, I imagined that others had similar issues, and thought this made things better
And that was one of the suggestions I was going to make :slightly_smiling_face:
Are there any use-cases that are considered complete/actionable?
Are there any use-cases that fit the template?
(that is a rather complete template - sets the bar quite high!)
I moved the currency swap to Milestone 1: the business requirements are filled and it's ready to define technical requirements
<https://github.com/hyperledger/hyperledger/wiki/Use-Case-Development-Dashboard>
I update this dashboard page to keep track of our progress
OK, thanks.
My suggestion would be to pick one or two to flesh out first, and maintain attention on those until they are complete - that way you can gather community interest around them

And, generally, to do it like painting - a small amount of detail per section, to provoke debate/discussion, and regular check-ins with the mailing list/community to validate when details are added to ensure that we're still on track
Then finally adding details to make something that might be used as a "spec" by a developer unfamiliar with the problem domain
Finally, we could have (later) docs on how to accomplish the use-case with Hyperledger projects
There is a list of use cases from the identity WG sessions. Where should I add it/merge it?
please add links to them under a section Identity Use Cases
to
<https://github.com/hyperledger/hyperledger/wiki/Requirements-WG>
thank you
ok
I've merged away the identity WG use cases inventory into the end of the Requirements-WG page. The old page is marked as deprecated. <@U0ULQ2G5V> <@U19GFUXD5> <#C114SSX41>
